answers.text:
Hi Joseph, 
Thank you for the great question on postage machines vs. online stamp resources! It is difficult to say which would be better for your specific local government since there are many factors to be considered in this cost benefit analysis. However, I have attached one document from the Knowledge Network and another link to an outside source that may help you answer this question for your municipality. 
•   In the document “Striving for Excellence-Virginia Beach: A Quality Government Organization” you will find on page 63 in the middle of the page you will find a paragraph discussing the use of postage machines in local government operations. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/1733
•   Here is a link to an outside source which runs a cost benefit analysis between using postage machines and online stamp resources.  This may provide you with some of the guidance you are looking for. http://www.resourcenation.com/blog/online-postage-vs-traditional-postage-meters/35295/
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Joseph Gacioch
text:
I am looking at an alternative to our Pitney Bowes postage machine.  Do any local governments out there have any experience with Stamps.com as a postage solution alternative to machine leases for municipal building locations?
Thanks!
title: Stamps.com versus Postage Rentals
